title: Import fails after Conda install
body_html:
I installed pytorch via Conda but some of the cuda files cannot be imported. TensorFlow installed via conda on the same machine is working.

  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4
  • PyTorch version: 0.3.1
  • How you installed PyTorch: conda
  • Python version: 3.6.1
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 8.0, cudnn 7.0.5
  • GPU models and configuration: GTX 1080
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): n/a

Steps:

  1. Install pytorch with conda
$ conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch
  1. Verify pytorch and cuda
$ conda list
# packages in environment at /home/[...]
#
[...]
cudatoolkit               8.0                           2 
cudnn                     7.0.5                 cuda8.0_0  
[...]
pytorch                   0.3.1           py36_cuda8.0.61_cudnn7.0.5_2    pytorch
  1. Try to import pytorch
$ python
Python 3.6.1 |Continuum Analytics, Inc.| (default, May 11 2017, 13:09:58) 
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-1)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/ak711/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 56, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: libnvToolsExt.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
